result.execSummary:
The defendant Domingo Apanecatl-Zacarias was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to the Department of Corrections by 4:00 PM on 9/20/2022. Unpon recommendation by the Probation Agent, early discharge may be granted after 6 months upon completion of terms of the sentence, including payment of court costs.

miscConds.notes: Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt. Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Must continue to follow through with all recommendations and services through the Department of Health and Human Services. 
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 3 days credit if revoked from probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Domingo Apanecatl-Zacarias

3:07 PM Defendant Domingo Apanecatl-Zacarias in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Domingo Apanecatl-Zacarias.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
3:07 Interpreter Sally Nichols with Swits connected via zoom/telephone, and sworn. 
Plea questionnaire filed. Victim rights have been complied with. 

State moves to amend to 940.19(1) a class A misd. Court grants amendment. Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty. Recommendation by State. Attorney Rockow relates. Defendant addresses the court. 

Court relates and orders: 

Sentence withheld - 1 year probation. Must report to the Department of Corrections by 4:00 PM on 9/20/2022 
Court grants early discharge upon recommendation by DOC after 6 months and upon completion of terms of the sentence, including payment of court costs. 
Court grants 3 days credit if revoked. 
Court costs payable within 60 days or payment plan. 
Must continue to follow through with all recommendations and services through the Department of Health and Human Services. 
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample. 


3:53 Interpretation ends. 

CC: DN/MN
Plea hearing on September 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Domingo Apanecatl-Zacarias in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Domingo Apanecatl-Zacarias. 11:12 a.m. Interpreter Salcedo appears by Zoom video.  Attorney Rockow requests breakout room with Defendant and Interpreter.  State relates on bond amendment and for Attorney Rockow to discuss bond modification with Defendant.   Case to be recalled.  ***11:32 a.m. case recalled.  Attorney Rockow relates and preliminary hearing waived and Arraignment requested.  Court questions Defendant.  The Court finds waiver of Preliminary hearing knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given, finds probable cause, and binds over for trial. Arraignment set.  Attorney Rockow relates on bond modification requested to No Abusive Contact.  State allows Court to read an email from DHS regarding bond modification and does not object.  Court grants bond modification to must have no abusive contact with  A. A.J.  dob  5-13-2009 and  must have no abusive contact with  M.J.   dob  10-23-1982. Amended bond to be signed at Clerk's office.  Court ends call with Interpreter at 11:45 a.m.
